moves.1. c4: I am never sure what to do against this opening, so I stick with my usual...
moves.1... e5 2. e3 e4: Why not take an extra space?
moves.3. d4: I contemplated En Passant here, but didn't want to open the board an leave my opponent with a strong position.
moves.5. Be2 Nf6 6. Qa4 Bd7 7. Qb3: Should have caught this, but here is where I make a blunder and get behind early.
moves.7... Be7 8. Qxb7 Na6: I make the choice to sacrifice my knight and save my rook, even though it leaves me vulnerable
moves.9. Qxa6 Bc8: I probably should have moved my queen to C8, but this is only my second mistake, haha
moves.10. Qxc6+ Bd7 11. Qa6 Bc8: Nothing to lose this time by trying it again...
moves.12. Bb5+ Nd7 13. Qc6 Rb8 14. Nc3: My opponent was going to get a pawn regardless, and I didn't like his position, so I chose to made another sacrifice, which ended up helping open the board back up for me and give me some wiggle room.
moves.14... a6 15. Bxa6 Bxa6 16. Qxa6 O-O: My pawn is still vulnerable, but I can make an even trade of pawn, pawn, knight, knight.  Which, I decided to do.
moves.17. Nxd5 Nxc5 18. dxc5 Qxd5: After the trades, my opponents pawn is now vulnerable
moves.19. c6: This move leaves an opening for my bishop to check
moves.19... Bb4+: I was hoping my opponent would make a blunder and block with his bishop...
moves.20. Ke2: But, alas, my opponent did not.
moves.20... Rbd8: With my king safe in the castle, I was now on the offensive.
moves.21. Nh3 Qh5+ 22. f3: This was my opponents mistake that I was able to take advantage of.
moves.22... exf3+: My oppenent could have captured my pawn to sacrifice his knight, but that is never an easy choice to make.
moves.23. Kf2 Bd2: I wanted my opponent to trade with this move, but it obviously would have left them in a tight spot.
moves.24. Rd1 fxg2:
This pawn is tearing it up.  My opponent can now trade my pawn for his rook, or we can trade bishop, and knight and leave my pawn sitting there on the goal line.

I love how his queen has been sitting over there doing nothing while all this transpires.
moves.25. Rxd2 Qxh3 26. Qa5: My opponent was finally able to move his queen.  At first I thought that this was an aggressive move that would force me into checkmate if I didn't trade rooks.  But after consideration, this was a passive move, and let me finish off his pawn.
moves.26... Qxh2: My opponent must get out of the way, or I am going to promote my pawn while putting him in check.  There is only one place to go without checkmate upon promotion...
moves.27. Kf3 Rxd2: I could have promoted my pawn here, and traded my queen for his rook.  This may have been the better move, but I wanted to get both of his rooks out of the way.
moves.28. Bxd2 g1=Q 29. Rxg1 Qxg1: I have now recovered from my early blunders to take the lead, although my opponent is in a good position to promote his pawn unless I can do something to stop it.
moves.30. c7 Qf1+: So the dance begins to keep his pawn from promoting
moves.31. Ke4 Qc4+ 32. Kf3 Rc8: Blocked successfully, but I am worried about my king trapped behind the castle wall
moves.33. e4: I contemplate making an escape route for my king here, but decide to take advantage of my queens position to eliminate the his goal line pawn.
moves.33... Rxc7 34. b3:
I am forced to move my queen, so I know that I must keep my opponent in check with my queen until I can move my rook out, all the while avoiding the easy checkmate of my king trapped behind the castle wall.

I thought that this was a really good move by my opponent.  I wasn't expecting it.
moves.34... Qf1+ 35. Ke3 Qh3+ 36. Kd4: I was worried my opponent would have moved his king the other direction, but he helped me out.
moves.37. Kc4 Qd3+: Now to move in for the kill.
moves.38. Kb4: This was a blunder on my opponents part, giving up his bishop.
moves.38... Qxd2+ 39. Kb5: Now trade queens, and the pawns are off to the races...
moves.39... Qxa5+ 40. Kxa5 h5 41. b4 h4 42. b5: At this point it is all but over.
moves.45. b7 Qb1 46. Ka7: I think that instead of resigning, my opponent surrendered with this move.
